title: Form filling guidance + support contact + work-from-home learning (frontend)

requirements.summary: Add core navigation and dedicated routes/pages for Guided Form Filling, Contact & Support, and Learn with English copy and responsive layout.
acceptanceCriteria: App has clearly labeled navigation to the three sections (Guided Form Filling, Contact & Support, Learn).
Each section renders a dedicated page/route with English headings and copy.
Pages are responsive and usable on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Create the app shell with a responsive header/nav linking to the three required sections, and a main content area that renders the routed pages. Compose (do not modify) shadcn-ui components for layout primitives (e.g., Button, Card, Separator) where useful. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Define and export the app routes for Guided Form Filling, Contact & Support, Learn, plus a safe default redirect or not-found handling to ensure all pages are reachable from navigation.

Add a reusable layout component (header/nav + content container) used by all routes to ensure consistent structure and responsive spacing. Compose (do not modify) shadcn-ui components as needed. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create the Guided Form Filling page route with English headings/copy and an entry point into the guided wizard.
Create the Contact & Support page route with English headings/copy, contact info area, and embedded help request form.
Create the Learn page route with English headings/copy, category-grouped lesson list, and a clear disclaimer area near the top.
Create the lesson detail route/page that displays lesson title, length indicator, body content, and disclaimers in English.

requirements.summary: Implement a step-by-step guided form-filling wizard with at least 3 form types, field tips/examples, validation, and a final review screen (no third-party submission).
acceptanceCriteria: User can choose from at least 3 form types (e.g., job application, survey, registration) and see a step-by-step wizard.
Each step displays field guidance (tips/examples) and basic validation (required fields, simple formats like email/phone).
A final review screen summarizes entered data and guidance reminders; the flow clearly states the user must submit on the external site themselves.

file_operations.description: Add shared TypeScript types for form types, wizard steps, field definitions, and validation results used by the guided form flow.
Provide at least 3 form templates (e.g., job application, survey, registration) defining required fields and per-field guidance (tips + examples) in English.
Implement basic client-side validation helpers (required fields, email format, phone format) for use in wizard steps.

Implement the multi-step wizard UI: form type selection, per-field steps with tips/examples, and a final review screen that explicitly states users must submit on the external site themselves. Compose (do not modify) shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Button, Input, Textarea, Progress) to build the wizard UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the GuidedFormWizard into the Guided Form Filling page with clear English instructions and a responsive layout.

requirements.summary: Build the Contact & Support page with support contact info and a validated help request form that submits to the backend and shows a success state.
acceptanceCriteria: Contact page displays at least: support email, hours/availability text, and a short support note in English.
Help request form validates required fields and email format on the client.
On submit, a backend call persists the help request and the UI shows a success state.
A backend query endpoint exists to list submitted help requests (for future admin use).

file_operations.description: Create a React Query hook that uses the existing actor (via core-infrastructure/useActor) to fetch and cache support contact info for display on the Contact & Support page.
Create a React Query mutation hook that calls the backend capability to submit a help request and returns a success result for the UI.

Implement the help request form (name, email, message) with client-side validation (required + email format), submit handling, and a clear success state. Compose (do not modify) shadcn-ui components (e.g., Form-related primitives if present, Input, Textarea, Button, Alert) for consistent UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Render support contact information (including support email, hours/availability text, and a short support note in English) plus the HelpRequestForm; ensure responsive layout and clear success/error messaging.

requirements.summary: Implement the Learn section with backend-served categories and lessons, lesson detail pages, and prominent disclaimers and scam-awareness checklist.
acceptanceCriteria: Learn page lists lessons grouped by category (e.g., freelancing basics, online surveys, content creation, remote customer support).
User can open a lesson detail view that shows title, reading time (or length indicator), and the lesson body in English.
UI prominently displays a disclaimer that results are not guaranteed and includes a short “scam awareness” checklist.
Lessons are served from the backend via query endpoints (not hardcoded only in the UI).

file_operations.description: Create a React Query hook to fetch lesson categories from the backend capability and cache results for the Learn page.
Create a React Query hook to fetch lessons for a given category from the backend capability; used to render grouped lesson lists.
Create a React Query hook to fetch a single lesson by id from the backend capability for the lesson detail page.
Create a React Query hook to fetch disclaimer text from the backend capability; used to render consistent disclaimers across Learn list and detail views.

Add a reusable scam-awareness checklist component in English that can be displayed prominently on Learn pages. Compose (do not modify) shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Badge, Separator) as needed. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement grouped lesson listing UI that renders categories with their lessons and links users to lesson detail routes. Compose (do not modify) shadcn-ui components (e.g., Accordion, Card, Button/Link styling) as needed. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Fetch categories and lessons from the backend via the new hooks, render lessons grouped by category, and display a prominent disclaimer plus the scam-awareness checklist near the top of the page.
Fetch and display lesson title, a reading-time/length indicator derived from content length, lesson body in English, and show the disclaimer plus scam-awareness checklist prominently.
Wire the lesson detail route (e.g., a route that accepts a lesson id) so users can navigate from the Learn list to the LessonDetailPage.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive warm-neutral educational/support theme across the app with green/orange accents and consistent typography/spacing; avoid blue/purple as primary colors.
acceptanceCriteria: UI uses a consistent theme (e.g., warm neutral background with green/orange accents) across all pages.
Typography and spacing are consistent; primary/secondary button styles are unified.
No blue/purple is used as the primary brand color.

file_operations.description: Create global styling entry with Tailwind + CSS variables for a warm neutral base and green/orange accents (ensuring primary is not blue/purple) compatible with shadcn-ui theming.
Adjust theme tokens or extended colors only as needed to support the warm neutral + green/orange accent palette and consistent typography/spacing across the app (avoid blue/purple as primary).

Ensure consistent spacing, typography hierarchy, and unified button/link styling in the shared layout using composed (not modified) shadcn-ui components. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add generated logo and hero illustration static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and display them in the header/nav and a landing/hero area (top of Learn page).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist in frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified in imageRequirements.required.
Header/nav displays the generated logo.
Home/landing area (or top of Learn page) displays the generated hero illustration.
Images are loaded as static assets from the frontend (not fetched via backend).

file_operations.description: Add the generated static logo asset at the exact required path: frontend/public/assets/generated/app-logo.dim_512x512.png.
Add the generated static hero illustration asset at the exact required path: frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-illustration.dim_1600x900.png.
Create a small brand logo component that renders the static image from frontend/public/assets/generated/app-logo.dim_512x512.png with accessible English alt text and size constraints.
Render the BrandLogo in the header/nav area so the logo is always visible during navigation.

Create a hero section component for the Learn page that renders the static image from frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-illustration.dim_1600x900.png along with concise English headline/subcopy and disclaimer placement. Compose (do not modify) shadcn-ui components for layout as needed. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the LearnHero at the top of the Learn page so the hero illustration is displayed prominently and responsively.
